ray.rage.common

Interface Manageable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Game
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractGame, BaseGame, Engine, VariableFrameRateGame

    public interface Manageable
    An manageable object is one whose setup and tear down is intended to be explicitly controlled to manage potentially expensive or sequence-sensitive operations with more predictability.

    This is mostly intended to be used by types that would benefit from being able to manually control their own setup and tear-down explicitly. For example, types that are expensive to set up or need to be initialized in a specific sequence are good candidates for implementing this interface.

    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void shutdown()
      Explicitly tears down this instance.
      void startup()
      Explicitly sets up this instance.
